meanings.definition: In a dual manner or way.
meanings.sent1: She completed her homework dually, first reading the instructions and then answering the questions.
meanings.sent2: The twins always walked dually, side by side, matching each other's steps.
meanings.sent3: The magician dually pulled a rabbit out of one hat and a dove out of the other, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked dually, analyzing the problem logically while also considering his intuition.
meanings.sent5: The sun set dually, casting a warm orange glow in the west and painting the sky with shades of pink in the east.

meanings.sent1: The dually colored car had a red body and a black roof, creating a striking contrast.
meanings.sent2: She wore a dually patterned scarf, with stripes on one side and polka dots on the other.
meanings.sent3: The dually flavored ice cream cone had vanilla on one side and chocolate on the other, pleasing both siblings.
meanings.sent4: His dually focused mind could switch between work tasks and personal projects seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The dually talented musician could play the piano with one hand and the guitar with the other simultaneously.
